meanings.definition: A subtle or underlying tone or shade
meanings.sent1: The artist added an undertint of blue to the painting to create a calming effect.
meanings.sent2: The photograph had a slight undertint of sepia, giving it a vintage look.
meanings.sent3: The undertint of mischief in his smile hinted at a playful prank in the making.
meanings.sent4: Her words carried an undertint of sadness, revealing her hidden emotions.
meanings.sent5: The undertint of fear in her eyes was unmistakable, betraying her true feelings.

meanings.sent1: There was an undertint of excitement in her voice when she mentioned the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: His words carried an undertint of warning, urging caution to the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The undertint of mystery in the story kept the readers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: The undertint of jealousy in her tone was hard to miss, revealing her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The undertint of hope in his message lifted her spirits, giving her renewed optimism.

meanings.definition: To give a slight color or shade to something
meanings.sent1: She decided to undertint the walls with a soft pink hue to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully undertinted the sky with hints of orange and purple for a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent3: He undertinted the photo with a vintage filter, giving it an old-fashioned look.
meanings.sent4: The makeup artist undertinted her cheeks with a rosy blush for a natural glow.
meanings.sent5: The decorator undertinted the curtains with a subtle green shade to complement the furniture.
